results.title: The Crystal space/time ship
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Infinity series”.
Using computer generated graphics and astrophotography, this virtually wordless video, explores the wonders of the universe, beginning at Mercury and journeying ever outwards into the outermost reaches of space/time.

results.title: The Crying red giant (K)
results.brief_description: Claymation film about a lonely red giant who wants to make friends with the people of the local village but everyone is afraid of him. Narrated in english. No other credits available. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: The Crying game (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Stephen Woolley, Palace Films, Channel Four, Euro Trustees, Nippon Film Development & Finance and Neil Jordan
results.brief_description: Full of surprises, this film did more than win extraordinary critical acclaim throughout the world. It upstaged the competition by receiving six Academy Award nominations and an Oscar for Best Screenplay. Set in Ireland, this spellbinding thriller involves a black British soldier, Jody (Forest Whittaker), who befriends his reluctant IRA captor, Fergus (Stephen Rea). When Jody is killed in an ambush, Fergus fulfills his dying wish - to find his girlfriend Dil (Jaye Davidson) in England. When Fergus and Dil become romantically involved, the crying game begins. Electrifying and seductive, this is the movie that had everyone talking. Co-starring Miranda Richardson.

results.title: The Crying Game
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and John Wood
results.brief_description:
A personal account created by a participant in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop Telling Tales. Produced in partnership with Arts Access and supported by the Department of Human Services and the Deafness Foundation for Telling Tales.
This story made by John Wood talks about his uncontrallable bouts of crying. This is sometimes brought about by depression or anxiety. He has learned that the expression of emotion is very healthy.

results.brief_description: Full of surprises, this film did more than win extraordinary critical acclaim throughout the world. It upstaged the competition by receiving six Academy Award nominations and an Oscar for Best Screenplay. Set in Ireland, this spellbinding thriller involves a black British soldier, Jody (Forest Whittaker), who befriends his reluctant IRA captor, Fergus (Stephen Rea). When Jody is killed in an ambush, Fergus fulfills his dying wish - to find his girlfriend Dil (Jaye Davidson) in England. When Fergus and Dil become romantically involved, the crying game begins. Electrifying and seductive, this is the movie that had everyone talking. Also stars Miranda Richardson.

results.title: The Cry of the gull
results.creator_credit: Montero-Fulton Productions, ONF | NFB, Gloria Montero and David Fulton
results.brief_description: The health and vitality of the gull reflect the “health” of the Great Lakes. When the gull population diminishes, biologists hasten to discover the reasons. The herring gull on Lake Ontario is in trouble, and so is the water. This film sounds a warning about the pollutants that are being pumped into these waters daily.

results.title: The Cry for help
results.creator_credit: Louisiana Association for Mental Health, George C Stoney Associates and George C. Stoney
results.brief_description: A training film for police officers and law enforcement agencies; presenting some of the major causes of suicide and follows with consequential discussion on how to handle the suicidal person. Quite powerful and graphic for it’s time.

results.title: The Crusades: saints and sinners
results.creator_credit: Learning Corporation of America and Victor Vicas
results.brief_description: Describes the first crusade, early in the 11th century, and the complex motives which led thousands of people to journey to the Holy Land. The climactic taking of Jerusalem is recreated, and the irony implicit in the concept of a holy war is examined.

results.title: The Crunch bird meets Kink Konk
results.creator_credit: Ted Petok and Crunch Bird Studios
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Muppet Coffee Break”.
A short animated film about a bird who misinterprets his manager’s instructions to obtain some ping pong balls. The bird triumphantly returns to his boss with a surprise package after his heroic encounter with King Kong. NOT SUITABLE FOR CHILDREN.
